# FitnessOverlays

FitnessOverlays is a free web application that generates customizable, transparent overlays from your Strava activities. Perfect for sharing runs, rides, and workouts on Instagram Stories, Reels, and TikTok.

## Quick Links

- **Live App**: https://fitnessoverlays.com
- **Try Demo**: https://fitnessoverlays.com/demo (no login required)
- **FAQ**: https://fitnessoverlays.com/#faq
- **GitHub**: https://github.com/spyroslontos/FitnessOverlays

## How It Works

1. **Connect**: OAuth 2.0 authentication with Strava (read-only access)
2. **Select**: Browse your recent activities from Strava
3. **Customize**: Choose metrics, colors, text size, alignment, and layout
4. **Export**: Download as transparent PNG or copy stats as text

## Supported Metrics

- Distance, Time, Pace/Speed
- Heart Rate (avg, max)
- Calories, Elevation Gain
- Cadence, Power (for cycling)
- Activity Name, Date, Type

## Tech Stack

### Backend
- Python 3.x with Flask
- SQLAlchemy (PostgreSQL)
- Redis for rate limiting
- Strava API v3 integration

### Frontend
- Tailwind CSS
- Flowbite components
- Vanilla JavaScript

### Deployment
- Docker-ready
- Environment-based configuration
- HTTPS required in production

## Development

### Local Setup
```bash
# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Set environment variables
cp .env.example .env

# Run development server
python server.py
```

### Environment Variables
- `CLIENT_ID`: Strava OAuth client ID
- `CLIENT_SECRET`: Strava OAuth client secret
- `SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI`: PostgreSQL connection string
- `RATELIMIT_STORAGE_URI`: Redis connection string
- `SECRET_KEY`: Flask session secret

## API Endpoints

- `GET /`: Homepage
- `GET /demo`: Demo with sample data
- `GET /login`: Initiate Strava OAuth
- `GET /callback`: OAuth callback handler
- `GET /activities`: View user activities (authenticated)
- `GET /customize`: Customize overlay (authenticated)
- `GET /api/activities/sync`: Fetch activities from Strava
- `POST /logout`: End user session

## Privacy & Security

- Read-only access to Strava data
- No data sold or shared with third parties
- HTTPS enforced in production
- Rate limiting on all endpoints
- CSRF protection on state-changing requests
